items.title: cli git additions
items.body:
`vapor new` now automatically initializes an empty Git repository in the newly created project. Added optional `--without-git` flag to prevent this behavior.

Closes #216.

items.title: fix `app.any` parameter label
items.body:
Forgot to make this label not required. 

Fixes #226

items.title: POST request routing from resource()
items.body: Fixed routing of POST requests to Controllers added to Application with resource(). Previously both GET and POST were routing to `index()`, now POST routes to `store()`

items.title: fluent
items.body:
Adds Fluent to Vapor.

We will need this as we start to create more advanced functionality like scheduled tasks, queues, etc.

Addresses #280

items.title: cli args config
items.body:
This makes the `host` (renamed from `ip`) and `port` pull from the configuration files instead of directly from the CLI.

I think this makes the project cleaner in terms of minimizing the amount of code for interacting with command line arguments and putting magic numbers where they belong in `Config`.

This is a work in progress since we will need to implement the `--config:app.port=8080` style cli arguments for `Config` to recreate the functionality we had previously.

items.title: Application grouping
items.body:
Adds more extensible grouping with the intention of also being threadsafe in the sense that routes don't become corrupted on multiple threads. Removes scoped state from Application.

Syntax Options:

``` Swift
let v1 = app.grouped("v1")
v1.get("users", Int) { req, id in 
    return "got path 'v1/users/:id'"
}
```

Or

``` Swift
app.grouped("v1") { group in
    group.get("users", Int) { req, id in 
        return "got path 'v1/users/:id'"
    }
}
```
#302

items.title: moving and to both and or to either for more clarity and natural reading
localization proposal
items.body:
Pretty basic localization proposal:

Create Localization Files in `/Localization`

```
- /Localization
    - default.json
    - en.json
    - es.json
```

Doesn't currently support nested folders w/in localization which we'll need if there's demand for localized assets in addition to strings, I don't think that complexity is necessary for our initial implementation, but open to discuss if it's a more common requirement than I think. For now, workaround would be to localize image name when requested.

Syntax:

``` Swift
let text = localization["en", "welcome-text"]
```

I'm hesitant about adding this to `App` since that will encourage capturing `self` w/in the closures. We should see if we can come up with another way to provide access. We could also just leave it global for users to implement manually however they prefer.
#251

items.title: fixing multipart parsing for one or more options
Created bridge that inherits from StringInitializable
content type bug
items.body:
Some clients send like:

```
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
```

items.title: Add open collective
items.body:
open collective backers and sponsor will now show in your readme. See as reference: github.com/apex/apex#backers

Replacing #330

items.title: Make Hash initializer public
items.body:
[Repeat of #336, addresses #195]

I believe that the Hash class's initialiser is not made public because configuration of the Hash is expected to be performed by:

```
app.hash.key = "secretkey"
```

However, in the initialiser of Application it is possible to set your own Hash instance, so it would appear to make sense to allow to be inited outside of the scope of the init of an Application.

There are also use cases for being able to have more than one Hash instance (with different keys) available at one time, or having an instance available without needing to create an Application along with it. I also can't think of any particularly good reasons for disallowing it, hence this pull request.

items.title: Make Hash's key and driver private and immutable
fluent 0.3.2
items.body: Update to latest Fluent with Preview 1 support
